name: Graphical interface with API of TVMaze
description:
This project contains a React JS user interface making use of the TVMaze rest API. This project was developed through my learning process of React JS and it's my first usable app with this JavaScript framework. You can search for shows stored in the TVMaze API.

How it works?

You just have to look for a show which is available in TVMaze, then you select by clicking the show you want to know more about. All the information related to the shows come from the TVMaze API and also you can add some comments to each show. This comments are stored in a personal database and get loaded to the page using a custom API made with PHP. All of this is possible thanks to the asynchronous property of JS (AJAX and Fetch API) and by a custom hook in React (useFetch).

Learned skills

  • Main working of the framework
  • Class components and functional components
  • Hooks (useState, useEffect and custom hooks)
  • SASS with React JS
  • CSS Animations
  • Advanced skills of JS (operators, arrow functions, destructuring, ...)
  • Making of a API with PHP and CORS policy
  • Pass data and events through components
  • Deploy of React app to Github pages

name: Smart Shopping Card Application
description:
Application for the use of a card in a educative environment (stationery shop and coffee shop). It works as a debit card which can be recharged and it's to buy things.

How it works...

This depends on the rol of each user.


Administrator

  • Database administration, user creation, products, finances.
  • Card chip assignment
  • Check shopping history
  • Recharge card

Seller

Each seller belongs to a specific section maybe stationer's shop or coffee shop

  • Check and add new products
  • Watch shopping history of each section.
  • Register user shoppings

Client / User

They are those who use the card. The user can:

  • Check the available balance of the card.
  • Watch the shopping history.

Card simulation

The system was thought to be working with a NFC card and Arduino. But this is made through a simulation. In the main page of this role, you can open the simulator by pressing the space bar key. A popup will be opened, so they should be allowed in the browser. This simulator can be used in wherever is needed.

name: Liturgical Repertoire. Catholic Liturgy Songs
description:
It's a web where lyrics and chords of catholic liturgy songs are stored. It allows you to see the different songs for each liturgical moment. Each one of the songs contain a guide video, lyrics and chords of the song. The web administrator can upload and add new songs or sections. All this is loaded dinamically through PHP.

Furthermore, it has the option to select the repertorie to be used, using the songs which are available in the list. Finally, it deliver the text in HTML format or in WhatsApp format to send it.
